address: Xã Xuân Trường, Huyện Bảo Lạc, Tỉnh Cao Bằng
thought:
**Analysis of Administrative Unit Changes for "Xã Xuân Trường, Huyện Bảo Lạc, Tỉnh Cao Bằng"**

Okay, so I've been asked to pinpoint the new administrative unit for "Xã Xuân Trường" in Bảo Lạc district, Cao Bằng province. My approach is pretty standard for this type of query. First, I identify the province, which is "Tỉnh Cao Bằng" here. No province-level mergers are happening according to the relevant resolutions, so Cao Bằng stays the same.

Next, I zero in on resolutions concerning sub-provincial changes, specifically focusing on Cao Bằng. The key document is "1657/NQ-UBTVQH15," which deals with restructuring at the commune level. I carefully scrutinize each line to see if "Xã Xuân Trường" is directly mentioned or involved in any mergers.

I quickly rule out several lines describing the merging of other communes in Bảo Lạc. However, line 12 of "1657/NQ-UBTVQH15" is crucial. It clearly states that "Xã Xuân Trường" is merging *with* "Xã Hồng An" to form a *new* "Xã Xuân Trường." Therefore, the old "Xã Xuân Trường" is now encompassed within this new, restructured commune.

To confirm my finding, I check the list of new wards and cross-reference with the information from the resolutions. The entry with the code "01339" perfectly matches the newly formed "Xã Xuân Trường" in Cao Bằng province.

Finally, to be absolutely certain, I scan other relevant resolutions for any conflicting uses of "Xuân Trường." While "Xuân Trường" appears in resolutions related to Đồng Nai, Lâm Đồng, Ninh Bình, and Thanh Hóa, these are all distinct and unrelated administrative units. My analysis confirms the original "Xã Xuân Trường" is now part of the merged commune also named "Xã Xuân Trường" along with "Xã Hồng An."

citation.header: 1657/NQ-UBTVQH15: Sắp xếp các đơn vị hành chính cấp xã của tỉnh Cao Bằng
citation.line: 12. Sắp xếp toàn bộ diện tích tự nhiên, quy mô dân số của xã Hồng An vàxã Xuân Trường thành xã mới có tên gọi là xã Xuân Trường.
